newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks close up, but far off day's high.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks close up, but far off day's high.

text.p: Stocks closed slightly higher on Monday after institutional selling in the afternoon session wiped out most of early gains, brokers said.
The composite index ended at 832.62, up 1.44 points on the day, but far off an intra-day high of 844.51.
"There was a strong selling pressure at the 840 point level," said LG Securities broker Koh Soon-shik. "The market will need some time to absorb the selling pressure."
The strong mood in early in the day was attributed to the launch of a new employee savings programme with tax benefits on those willing to invest in the stock market, brokers said.
Advancing shares beat decliners by 513 to 365, with 134 stocks remaining unchanged.
"The index rise was small because of losses of blue chips and large-cap shares," said Koh. Large-cap stocks are heavily weighted on the index.

Among blue chips, Samsung Electronics fell 2,000 won to 65,500 and Hyundai Motor shed 400 won to 28,600. Bucking the large-cap weakeness, Korea Electric Power Corp gained 200 won to 26,700 and Pohang Iron and Steel Co was up 100 won to 44,700.
The bribery scandal involving former defence minister Lee Yang-ho had little impact on the market, brokers said.
State prosecutors launched an investigation of the scandal, sparked by allegations from opposition lawmakers that Lee had leaked classified military secrets to an arms dealer in return for bribes.

Hyundai Securities gained 1,000 won to its daily limit of 17,700 on a newspaper report that the government was considering allowing Hyundai Group to take a controlling stake in Citizens Investment Trust Management Co.
The government denied the report, but investors continued buying the shares, brokers said.

Kyongnam Bank fell 200 won to 10,300 on the bank's announcement of a loan fraud. The bank said on Saturday that documents submitted by 14 firms to which it had extended 10.7 billion won in loans had proved to be fraudulent.
The index futures December contracts closed 0.50 points lower at 87.20 while the KOSPI-200 index fell 0.25 points to close at 87.30.
